QuestionJSON.Question: Surfer owns a local bakery and has recently decided to incorporate a new software system for inventory management. The software uses predictive analytics to ensure a more efficient stock management system. It leverages past sales data, weather forecasts and local events to predict sales, and hence inventory needs of every product in the shop. How can Surfer's life change after adopting this new computing technology?
QuestionJSON.Answer1: Surfer will have to hire a dedicated team to manage the software and interpret its results.
QuestionJSON.Answer2: Surfer will have to invest significantly in new physical infrastructure to accommodate the technology.
QuestionJSON.Answer3: Surfer might be able to reduce waste, enhance operational efficiency, and improve customer service by having the right amount of stock at the right time based on predictive analytics.
QuestionJSON.Answer4: The new technology will make Surfer's life more complicated since it's difficult to predict baking needs accurately.
QuestionJSON.Explanation: Implementing new computing technology like predictive analytics for inventory management can greatly improve a business's efficiency. In Surfer's case, it can help them to anticipate demand better, reduce waste from unsold baked goods, and improve customer experience by having popular items always available. While there may be challenges in adopting a new system, the benefits often outweigh them in the long run.
